00013 #ifndef RAY_H
00014 #define RAY_H

00016 #include <geometry/Geometry.hpp>
00017 #include <geometry/Vec3.hpp>
00018 #include <geometry/Plane.hpp>
00019 #include <geometry/Box3.hpp>

00021 namespace geo
00022 {
00032     template<typename Type>
00033     class Ray
00034     {
00035     public:
00037         Ray(const Ray<Type> & a_ray)
00038         {
00039             m_origin = a_ray.m_origin;
00040             m_direction = a_ray.m_direction;
00041         }
00042 
00044         Ray(const Vec3<Type> & a_origin, const Vec3<Type> & a_direction, bool normalize = true)
00045         {
00046             setValue(a_origin, a_direction, normalize);
00047         }
00048 
00050         virtual ~Ray(){}
00051 
00053         void setValue(const Vec3<Type> & a_origin, const Vec3<Type> & a_direction, bool normalize = true)
00054         {
00055             m_origin = a_origin;
00056             m_direction = a_direction;
00057             if(normalize) m_direction.normalize();
00058         }
00059 
00061         const Vec3<Type> & getOrigin() const
00062         { 
00063             return m_origin; 
00064         }
00065 
00067         const Vec3<Type> & getDirection() const
00068         { 
00069             return m_direction; 
00070         }
00071 
00073         Vec3<Type> getValue(Type t) const
00074         {
00075             return Vec3<Type>(m_origin + t*m_direction);
00076         }
00077 
00079         Type getDistance(const Vec3<Type> & pt) const
00080         {
00081             return std::sqrt(getSqrDistance(pt));
00082         }
00083 
00085         Type getSqrDistance(const Vec3<Type> & pt) const
00086         {
00087             Type t = (pt - m_origin).dot(m_direction);
00088 
00089             return (getValue(t) - pt).sqrLength();
00090         }
00091 
00093         Ray<Type> reflect(const Vec3<Type>& newOrigin, const Vec3<Type>& normal) const
00094         {
00095             return Ray<Type>(newOrigin, m_direction - 2.0f * (m_direction.dot(normal)) * normal);
00096         }
00097 
00099         Vec3<Type> project(const Vec3<Type> & pt) const
00100         {
00101             Type numerator = (pt - m_origin).dot(m_direction);
00102             Type denumerator = m_direction.length();
00103 
00104             return (m_origin + m_direction * (numerator / denumerator));
00105         }
00106 
00113         bool intersect(const Vec3<Type> & vert0, const Vec3<Type> & vert1, const Vec3<Type> & vert2, Vec3<Type> & a_tuv) const
00114         {
00115             // Tomas Moller and Ben Trumbore.
00116             // Fast, minimum storage ray-triangle intersection.
00117             // Journal of graphics tools, 2(1):21-28, 1997
00118 
00119             // find vectors for two edges sharing vert0 
00120             Vec3<Type> edge1 = vert1 - vert0;
00121             Vec3<Type> edge2 = vert2 - vert0;
00122 
00123             // begin calculating determinant - also used to calculate U parameter 
00124             Vec3<Type> pvec = m_direction.cross(edge2);
00125 
00126             // if determinant is near zero, ray lies in plane of triangle 
00127             Type det = edge1.dot(pvec);
00128 
00129             if (det < EPS)
00130                 return false;
00131 
00132             // calculate distance from vert0 to ray origin 
00133             Vec3<Type> tvec = m_origin - vert0;
00134 
00135             // calculate U parameter and test bounds
00136             a_tuv[1] = tvec.dot(pvec);
00137 
00138             if (a_tuv[1] < 0.0 || a_tuv[1] > det)
00139                 return false;
00140 
00141             // prepare to test V parameter
00142             Vec3<Type> qvec = tvec.cross(edge1);
00143 
00144             // calculate V parameter and test bounds
00145             a_tuv[2] = m_origin.dot(qvec);
00146 
00147             if (a_tuv[2] < 0.0 || a_tuv[1] + a_tuv[2] > det)
00148                 return false;
00149 
00150             // calculate t, scale parameters, ray intersects triangle
00151             a_tuv[0] = edge2.dot(qvec);
00152 
00153             Type inv_det = (Type)1.0 / det;
00154 
00155             a_tuv[0] *= inv_det;
00156             a_tuv[1] *= inv_det;
00157             a_tuv[2] *= inv_det;
00158 
00159             return true;
00160         }
00161 
00163         bool intersect(const Ray<Type> & a_ray, Type & mua, Type & mub) const
00164         {
00165             // Based on code from Paul Bourke
00166             // http://astronomy.swin.edu.au/~pbourke
00167             Vec3<Type> p1 = m_origin;
00168             Vec3<Type> p2 = m_origin + 1.0f * m_direction;
00169             Vec3<Type> p3 = a_ray.m_origin;
00170             Vec3<Type> p4 = a_ray.m_origin + 1.0f * a_ray.m_direction;
00171 
00172             Vec3<Type> p13 = p1 - p3;
00173             Vec3<Type> p43 = p4 - p3;
00174 
00175             if(std::abs(p43[0]) < EPS && std::abs(p43[1]) < EPS && std::abs(p43[2]) < EPS) return false;
00176 
00177             Vec3<Type> p21 = p2 - p1;
00178 
00179             if(std::abs(p21[0]) < EPS && std::abs(p21[1]) < EPS && std::abs(p21[2]) < EPS) return false;
00180 
00181             Type d1343 = p13.dot(p43);
00182             Type d4321 = p43.dot(p21);
00183             Type d1321 = p13.dot(p21);
00184             Type d4343 = p43.dot(p43);
00185             Type d2121 = p21.dot(p21);
00186 
00187             Type denom = d2121 * d4343 - d4321 * d4321;
00188 
00189             if(std::abs(denom) < EPS) return false;
00190 
00191             Type numer = d1343 * d4321 - d1321 * d4343;
00192 
00193             mua = numer / denom;
00194             mub = (d1343 + d4321 * mua) / d4343;
00195 
00196             return true;
00197         }
00198 
00200         friend bool operator ==(const Ray<Type> & r1, const Ray<Type> & r2)
00201         { 
00202             return(r1.m_origin == r2.m_origin && r1.m_direction == r2.m_direction); 
00203         }
00204 
00206         friend bool operator !=(const Ray<Type> & r1, const Ray<Type> & r2)
00207         { 
00208             return !(r1 == r2); 
00209         }
00210 
00211     private:
00212         Vec3<Type> m_origin;    
00213         Vec3<Type> m_direction; 
00214     };

00219     typedef Ray<double> Rayd;
